trans-unit.source: This C# Intermediate tutorial covers the usage of asynchronous scripts or async scripts.
trans-unit.target: This C# Intermediate tutorial covers the usage of asynchronous scripts or async scripts.

trans-unit.source: Up until this point every tutorial has been using sync scripts. That means that those scripts are executed right after each other. If one particular sync script would take 1 second to complete, our game would freeze that 1 second, until the update loop is complete. All of the previously made Sync scripts can be made into an Async script.
trans-unit.target: Up until this point every tutorial has been using sync scripts. That means that those scripts are executed right after each other. If one particular sync script would take 1 second to complete, our game would freeze that 1 second, until the update loop is complete. All of the previously made Sync scripts can be made into an Async script.

trans-unit.source: With Async scripts we can perform heavy duty operations or reach out to an api without it freezing our application. A game can be made entirely with either Sync or Async scripts, or a combination of them both.
trans-unit.target: With Async scripts we can perform heavy duty operations or reach out to an api without it freezing our application. A game can be made entirely with either Sync or Async scripts, or a combination of them both.

trans-unit.source: Retrieving data from a web api
trans-unit.target: Retrieving data from a web api

trans-unit.source: A common use case for async scripts is retrieving data from a web API. Depending on the speed of the API and the amount of data to be retrieved, this can take up to somewhere between 20 milliseconds and 2 seconds. [!code-csharpAsyncWebApi]
trans-unit.target: A common use case for async scripts is retrieving data from a web API. Depending on the speed of the API and the amount of data to be retrieved, this can take up to somewhere between 20 milliseconds and 2 seconds. [!code-csharpAsyncWebApi]

trans-unit.source: In a previous tutorial we made a collision trigger script that would notify the user once an object is passing through it. We can make a similar script using Async script. [!code-csharpAsyncCollisionTrigger]
trans-unit.target: In a previous tutorial we made a collision trigger script that would notify the user once an object is passing through it. We can make a similar script using Async script. [!code-csharpAsyncCollisionTrigger]
